technical_risks.risk: TheaterDetectionEngine has 8 detector modules but only 2 fully implemented
technical_risks.mitigation: Complete implementation of remaining 6 detector modules

technical_risks.risk: Supply chain analyzer parallel processing may cause memory pressure
technical_risks.mitigation: Add memory usage monitoring and task batching
technical_risks.evidence: No memory limits on parallel vulnerability scanning

technical_risks.risk: Compliance orchestrator defaults to broad framework scanning
technical_risks.evidence: Default enables all frameworks without resource consideration

technical_risks.risk: Six Sigma report generator creates multiple duplicate reports
technical_risks.mitigation: Implement report deduplication and version control
technical_risks.evidence: Multiple reports with same timestamp pattern in artifacts

theater_detection_findings.description: Minor focus on LOC metrics in documentation
theater_detection_findings.recommendation: Continue focus on business value metrics

theater_detection_findings.description: Complexity levels are justified by enterprise requirements
theater_detection_findings.evidence: NASA POT10 compliance necessitates rigorous validation

theater_detection_findings.description: Abstraction layers provide genuine modularity and testability
theater_detection_findings.evidence: Clear separation of concerns across domains

supporting_evidence: Comprehensive test coverage in all domains
Audit trail generation with retention management
Audit trail generation with integrity verification

gaps: Only 2 of 8 detector modules fully implemented

genuine_evidence: Compliance audit packages with framework evidence
Six Sigma statistical analysis with DPMO calculations
Supply chain SBOM and provenance attestations
Quality validation reports with gate enforcement
potential_theater: Multiple duplicate Six Sigma reports with same timestamp
Sparse theater detection report with minimal patterns
Dashboard data without actual UI implementation

spec_improvements: Add explicit memory usage limits for parallel processing operations
Define error handling patterns for all async compliance operations
Specify artifact deduplication requirements to prevent report bloat
Include performance benchmarking requirements for theater detection algorithms
plan_refinements: Complete implementation of remaining theater detection modules
Add comprehensive integration tests for multi-framework compliance
Implement artifact versioning and deduplication systems
Add memory usage profiling for large-scale vulnerability scanning
technical_debt_risks: Theater detection engine has 6 unimplemented detector modules
Configuration management scattered across multiple config files
Report generation lacks versioning and deduplication
Error handling patterns inconsistent across domain modules
testing_challenges: Mocking enterprise compliance frameworks requires significant setup
Integration testing across all 5 domains needs orchestration
Performance testing under enterprise-scale loads is complex
Theater detection validation requires carefully crafted test cases
quality_checkpoints: Verify all async operations have proper timeout and retry handling
Ensure compliance evidence has proper retention and cleanup
Validate that performance monitoring accurately tracks overhead
Confirm theater detection patterns correlate with actual code quality

key_strengths: Performance monitoring with actual overhead tracking
Modular architecture with clear separation of concerns
areas_for_improvement: Add artifact deduplication to prevent report bloat
Enhance error handling consistency across domains

reasoning_trace.methodology: Fresh-eyes analysis with focus on substance over theater
key_findings: Analyzed 42 files totaling 20,851 LOC across 5 enterprise domains
Found minimal technical debt (4 markers, 0.02% ratio)
Verified genuine compliance implementations with working code
Identified specific incomplete implementations vs vague promises
Theater risk remains low (7-15% across domains) with high value correlation
validation_approach: Code-level examination for actual vs claimed functionality
Artifact analysis for genuine vs generated content
Performance overhead verification against stated targets
Reality correlation analysis between claims and evidence
